title: PHPchdir()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPchdir()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content: Example Change the current directory: "; // Change directory chdir("images"); // Get current directory echo getcwd(); ?> Result: /home/php /home/php/images Definition and Usage The chdir() function changes the current directory. Syntax chdir( directory ) Parameter Values Parameter Description directory Required. Specifies the new current directory Technical Details Return Value: TRUE on success. FALSE on failure. Throws an error of level E_WARNING on failure PHP Version: 4.0+ ★ +1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code: "; // Change directory chdir("images"); // Get current directory echo getcwd(); ?>

summary: This tutorial covers PHPchdir()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPchdir()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPchdir()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
